body_html:
Here's a word doc with images of the afterburner output during a period when the GPU stalling is visible:
afterburner logs.docx

It seems you're correct about the CPU idea; CPUs 1 and 2 (and some of the others) tend to exhibit high activity during the "GPU stalls".

I'll upload a .py file and some test data with a version of my CNN that should hopefully replicate the issue later today.
body_text:

body:
Here's a word doc with images of the afterburner output during a period when the GPU stalling is visible:
[afterburner logs.docx](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/files/1876339/afterburner.logs.docx)

It seems you're correct about the CPU idea; CPUs 1 and 2 (and some of the others) tend to exhibit high activity during the "GPU stalls". 

I'll upload a .py file and some test data with a version of my CNN that should hopefully replicate the issue later today.
